member.name: F:SQLite.CreateFlags.None
member.summary: Use the default creation options

member.name: F:SQLite.CreateFlags.ImplicitPK
member.summary: Create a primary key index for a property called 'Id' (case-insensitive). This avoids the need for the [PrimaryKey] attribute.

member.name: F:SQLite.CreateFlags.ImplicitIndex
member.summary: Create indices for properties ending in 'Id' (case-insensitive).

member.name: F:SQLite.CreateFlags.AllImplicit
member.summary: Create a primary key for a property called 'Id' and create an indices for properties ending in 'Id' (case-insensitive).

member.name: F:SQLite.CreateFlags.AutoIncPK
member.summary: Force the primary key property to be auto incrementing. This avoids the need for the [AutoIncrement] attribute. The primary key property on the class should have type int or long.

member.name: F:SQLite.CreateFlags.FullTextSearch3
member.summary: Create virtual table using FTS3

member.name: F:SQLite.CreateFlags.FullTextSearch4
member.summary: Create virtual table using FTS4

member.name: T:SQLite.SQLiteConnection
member.summary: An open connection to a SQLite database.

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.DatabasePath
member.summary: Gets the database path used by this connection.

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.LibVersionNumber
member.summary: Gets the SQLite library version number. 3007014 would be v3.7.14

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.TimeExecution
member.summary: Whether Trace lines should be written that show the execution time of queries.

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Trace
member.summary: Whether to write queries to during execution.

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Tracer
member.summary: The delegate responsible for writing trace lines.

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.StoreDateTimeAsTicks
member.summary: Whether to store DateTime properties as ticks (true) or strings (false).

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.StoreTimeSpanAsTicks
member.summary: Whether to store TimeSpan properties as ticks (true) or strings (false).

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.DateTimeStringFormat
member.summary: The format to use when storing DateTime properties as strings. Ignored if StoreDateTimeAsTicks is true.

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.DateTimeStyle
member.summary: The DateTimeStyles value to use when parsing a DateTime property string.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructs a new SQLiteConnection and opens a SQLite database specified by databasePath.
member.param: Specifies the path to the database file.

Specifies whether to store DateTime properties as ticks (true) or strings (false). You absolutely do want to store them as Ticks in all new projects. The value of false is only here for backwards compatibility. There is a *significant* speed advantage, with no down sides, when setting storeDateTimeAsTicks = true. If you use DateTimeOffset properties, it will be always stored as ticks regardingless the storeDateTimeAsTicks parameter.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.#ctor(System.String,SQLite.SQLiteOpenFlags,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructs a new SQLiteConnection and opens a SQLite database specified by databasePath.
member.param: Specifies the path to the database file.
Flags controlling how the connection should be opened.

Specifies whether to store DateTime properties as ticks (true) or strings (false). You absolutely do want to store them as Ticks in all new projects. The value of false is only here for backwards compatibility. There is a *significant* speed advantage, with no down sides, when setting storeDateTimeAsTicks = true. If you use DateTimeOffset properties, it will be always stored as ticks regardingless the storeDateTimeAsTicks parameter.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.#ctor(SQLite.SQLiteConnectionString)
member.summary: Constructs a new SQLiteConnection and opens a SQLite database specified by databasePath.
member.param: Details on how to find and open the database.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.EnableWriteAheadLogging
member.summary: Enables the write ahead logging. WAL is significantly faster in most scenarios by providing better concurrency and better disk IO performance than the normal journal mode. You only need to call this function once in the lifetime of the database.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Quote(System.String)
member.summary: Convert an input string to a quoted SQL string that can be safely used in queries.
member.returns: The quoted string.
member.param: The unsafe string to quote.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.SetKey(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the key used to encrypt/decrypt the database with "pragma key = ...". This must be the first thing you call before doing anything else with this connection if your database is encrypted. This only has an effect if you are using the SQLCipher nuget package.
member.param: Ecryption key plain text that is converted to the real encryption key using PBKDF2 key derivation

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.SetKey(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Sets the key used to encrypt/decrypt the database. This must be the first thing you call before doing anything else with this connection if your database is encrypted. This only has an effect if you are using the SQLCipher nuget package.
member.param: 256-bit (32 byte) ecryption key data

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.EnableLoadExtension(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable or disable extension loading.

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.BusyTimeout
member.summary: Sets a busy handler to sleep the specified amount of time when a table is locked. The handler will sleep multiple times until a total time of has accumulated.

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.TableMappings
member.summary: Returns the mappings from types to tables that the connection currently understands.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.GetMapping(System.Type,SQLite.CreateFlags)
member.summary: Retrieves the mapping that is automatically generated for the given type.
member.param: The type whose mapping to the database is returned.
Optional flags allowing implicit PK and indexes based on naming conventions
member.returns: The mapping represents the schema of the columns of the database and contains methods to set and get properties of objects.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.GetMapping``1(SQLite.CreateFlags)
member.summary: Retrieves the mapping that is automatically generated for the given type.
member.param: Optional flags allowing implicit PK and indexes based on naming conventions
member.returns: The mapping represents the schema of the columns of the database and contains methods to set and get properties of objects.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.DropTable``1
member.summary: Executes a "drop table" on the database. This is non-recoverable.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.DropTable(SQLite.TableMapping)
member.summary: Executes a "drop table" on the database. This is non-recoverable.
member.param: The TableMapping used to identify the table.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.CreateTable``1(SQLite.CreateFlags)
member.summary: Executes a "create table if not exists" on the database. It also creates any specified indexes on the columns of the table. It uses a schema automatically generated from the specified type. You can later access this schema by calling GetMapping.
member.returns: Whether the table was created or migrated.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.CreateTable(System.Type,SQLite.CreateFlags)
member.summary: Executes a "create table if not exists" on the database. It also creates any specified indexes on the columns of the table. It uses a schema automatically generated from the specified type. You can later access this schema by calling GetMapping.
member.param: Type to reflect to a database table.
Optional flags allowing implicit PK and indexes based on naming conventions.
member.returns: Whether the table was created or migrated.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.CreateTables``2(SQLite.CreateFlags)
member.summary: Executes a "create table if not exists" on the database for each type. It also creates any specified indexes on the columns of the table. It uses a schema automatically generated from the specified type. You can later access this schema by calling GetMapping.
member.returns: Whether the table was created or migrated for each type.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.CreateTables``3(SQLite.CreateFlags)
member.summary: Executes a "create table if not exists" on the database for each type. It also creates any specified indexes on the columns of the table. It uses a schema automatically generated from the specified type. You can later access this schema by calling GetMapping.
member.returns: Whether the table was created or migrated for each type.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.CreateTables``4(SQLite.CreateFlags)
member.summary: Executes a "create table if not exists" on the database for each type. It also creates any specified indexes on the columns of the table. It uses a schema automatically generated from the specified type. You can later access this schema by calling GetMapping.
member.returns: Whether the table was created or migrated for each type.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.CreateTables``5(SQLite.CreateFlags)
member.summary: Executes a "create table if not exists" on the database for each type. It also creates any specified indexes on the columns of the table. It uses a schema automatically generated from the specified type. You can later access this schema by calling GetMapping.
member.returns: Whether the table was created or migrated for each type.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.CreateTables(SQLite.CreateFlags,System.Type[])
member.summary: Executes a "create table if not exists" on the database for each type. It also creates any specified indexes on the columns of the table. It uses a schema automatically generated from the specified type. You can later access this schema by calling GetMapping.
member.returns: Whether the table was created or migrated for each type.

Whether the index should be unique

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.GetTableInfo(System.String)
member.summary: Query the built-in sqlite table_info table for a specific tables columns.
member.returns: The columns contains in the table.
member.param: Table name.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.NewCommand
member.summary: Creates a new SQLiteCommand. Can be overridden to provide a sub-class.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.CreateCommand(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a new SQLiteCommand given the command text with arguments. Place a '?' in the command text for each of the arguments.
member.param: The fully escaped SQL.
Arguments to substitute for the occurences of '?' in the command text.
member.returns: A

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.CreateCommand(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Creates a new SQLiteCommand given the command text with named arguments. Place a "[@:$]VVV" in the command text for each of the arguments. VVV represents an alphanumeric identifier. For example, @name :name and $name can all be used in the query.
member.param: The fully escaped SQL.
Arguments to substitute for the occurences of "[@:$]VVV" in the command text.
member.returns: A

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Execute(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a SQLiteCommand given the command text (SQL) with arguments. Place a '?' in the command text for each of the arguments and then executes that command. Use this method instead of Query when you don't expect rows back. Such cases include INSERTs, UPDATEs, and DELETEs. You can set the Trace or TimeExecution properties of the connection to profile execution.
member.param: The fully escaped SQL.
Arguments to substitute for the occurences of '?' in the query.
member.returns: The number of rows modified in the database as a result of this execution.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.ExecuteScalar``1(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a SQLiteCommand given the command text (SQL) with arguments. Place a '?' in the command text for each of the arguments and then executes that command. Use this method when return primitive values. You can set the Trace or TimeExecution properties of the connection to profile execution.
member.param: The fully escaped SQL.
Arguments to substitute for the occurences of '?' in the query.
member.returns: The number of rows modified in the database as a result of this execution.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Query``1(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a SQLiteCommand given the command text (SQL) with arguments. Place a '?' in the command text for each of the arguments and then executes that command. It returns each row of the result using the mapping automatically generated for the given type.
member.param: The fully escaped SQL.
Arguments to substitute for the occurences of '?' in the query.
member.returns: An enumerable with one result for each row returned by the query.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.QueryScalars``1(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a SQLiteCommand given the command text (SQL) with arguments. Place a '?' in the command text for each of the arguments and then executes that command. It returns the first column of each row of the result.
member.param: The fully escaped SQL.
Arguments to substitute for the occurences of '?' in the query.
member.returns: An enumerable with one result for the first column of each row returned by the query.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.DeferredQuery``1(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a SQLiteCommand given the command text (SQL) with arguments. Place a '?' in the command text for each of the arguments and then executes that command. It returns each row of the result using the mapping automatically generated for the given type.
member.param: The fully escaped SQL.
Arguments to substitute for the occurences of '?' in the query.
member.returns: An enumerable with one result for each row returned by the query. The enumerator (retrieved by calling GetEnumerator() on the result of this method) will call sqlite3_step on each call to MoveNext, so the database connection must remain open for the lifetime of the enumerator.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Query(SQLite.TableMapping,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a SQLiteCommand given the command text (SQL) with arguments. Place a '?' in the command text for each of the arguments and then executes that command. It returns each row of the result using the specified mapping. This function is only used by libraries in order to query the database via introspection. It is normally not used.
member.param: A to use to convert the resulting rows into objects.
The fully escaped SQL.
Arguments to substitute for the occurences of '?' in the query.
member.returns: An enumerable with one result for each row returned by the query.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.DeferredQuery(SQLite.TableMapping,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a SQLiteCommand given the command text (SQL) with arguments. Place a '?' in the command text for each of the arguments and then executes that command. It returns each row of the result using the specified mapping. This function is only used by libraries in order to query the database via introspection. It is normally not used.
member.param: A to use to convert the resulting rows into objects.
The fully escaped SQL.
Arguments to substitute for the occurences of '?' in the query.
member.returns: An enumerable with one result for each row returned by the query. The enumerator (retrieved by calling GetEnumerator() on the result of this method) will call sqlite3_step on each call to MoveNext, so the database connection must remain open for the lifetime of the enumerator.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Table``1
member.summary: Returns a queryable interface to the table represented by the given type.
member.returns: A queryable object that is able to translate Where, OrderBy, and Take queries into native SQL.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Get``1(System.Object)
member.summary: Attempts to retrieve an object with the given primary key from the table associated with the specified type. Use of this method requires that the given type have a designated PrimaryKey (using the PrimaryKeyAttribute).
member.param: The primary key.
member.returns: The object with the given primary key. Throws a not found exception if the object is not found.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Get(System.Object,SQLite.TableMapping)
member.summary: Attempts to retrieve an object with the given primary key from the table associated with the specified type. Use of this method requires that the given type have a designated PrimaryKey (using the PrimaryKeyAttribute).
member.param: The primary key.

member.returns: The object with the given primary key. Throws a not found exception if the object is not found.

member.summary: Attempts to retrieve the first object that matches the predicate from the table associated with the specified type.
member.param: A predicate for which object to find.
member.returns: The object that matches the given predicate. Throws a not found exception if the object is not found.

member.param: The primary key.
member.returns: The object with the given primary key or null if the object is not found.

member.summary: Attempts to retrieve an object with the given primary key from the table associated with the specified type. Use of this method requires that the given type have a designated PrimaryKey (using the PrimaryKeyAttribute).
member.param: The primary key.
The TableMapping used to identify the table.
member.returns: The object with the given primary key or null if the object is not found.

member.param: A predicate for which object to find.
member.returns: The object that matches the given predicate or null if the object is not found.

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.IsInTransaction
member.summary: Whether has been called and the database is waiting for a .

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.BeginTransaction
member.summary: Begins a new transaction. Call to end the transaction.
member.example: Throws if a transaction has already begun.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.SaveTransactionPoint
member.summary:
Creates a savepoint in the database at the current point in the transaction timeline. Begins a new transaction if one is not in progress.
Call to undo transactions since the returned savepoint. Call to commit transactions after the savepoint returned here. Call to end the transaction, committing all changes.
member.returns: A string naming the savepoint.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Rollback
member.summary: Rolls back the transaction that was begun by or .

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.RollbackTo(System.String)
member.summary: Rolls back the savepoint created by or SaveTransactionPoint.
member.param: The name of the savepoint to roll back to, as returned by . If savepoint is null or empty, this method is equivalent to a call to

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.RollbackTo(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Rolls back the transaction that was begun by .
member.param: The name of the savepoint to roll back to, as returned by . If savepoint is null or empty, this method is equivalent to a call to
true to avoid throwing exceptions, false otherwise

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Release(System.String)
member.summary:
Releases a savepoint returned from . Releasing a savepoint makes changes since that savepoint permanent if the savepoint began the transaction, or otherwise the changes are permanent pending a call to .
The RELEASE command is like a COMMIT for a SAVEPOINT.
member.param: The name of the savepoint to release. The string should be the result of a call to

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Commit
member.summary: Commits the transaction that was begun by .

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.RunInTransaction(System.Action)
member.summary: Executes within a (possibly nested) transaction by wrapping it in a SAVEPOINT. If an exception occurs the whole transaction is rolled back, not just the current savepoint. The exception is rethrown.
member.param: The to perform within a transaction. can contain any number of operations on the connection but should never call or .

member.returns: The number of rows added to the table.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.InsertOrReplace(System.Object)
member.summary: Inserts the given object (and updates its auto incremented primary key if it has one). The return value is the number of rows added to the table. If a UNIQUE constraint violation occurs with some pre-existing object, this function deletes the old object.
member.param: The object to insert.
member.returns: The number of rows modified.

The type of object to insert.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Update(System.Object)
member.summary: Updates all of the columns of a table using the specified object except for its primary key. The object is required to have a primary key.
member.param: The object to update. It must have a primary key designated using the PrimaryKeyAttribute.
member.returns: The number of rows updated.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Update(System.Object,System.Type)
member.summary: Updates all of the columns of a table using the specified object except for its primary key. The object is required to have a primary key.
member.param: The object to update. It must have a primary key designated using the PrimaryKeyAttribute.
The type of object to insert.
member.returns: The number of rows updated.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.UpdateAll(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates all specified objects.
member.param: An of the objects to insert.
A boolean indicating if the inserts should be wrapped in a transaction
member.returns: The number of rows modified.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Delete(System.Object)
member.summary: Deletes the given object from the database using its primary key.
member.param: The object to delete. It must have a primary key designated using the PrimaryKeyAttribute.
member.returns: The number of rows deleted.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Delete``1(System.Object)
member.summary: Deletes the object with the specified primary key.
member.param: The primary key of the object to delete.
member.returns: The number of objects deleted.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Delete(System.Object,SQLite.TableMapping)
member.summary: Deletes the object with the specified primary key.
member.param: The primary key of the object to delete.
The TableMapping used to identify the table.
member.returns: The number of objects deleted.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.DeleteAll``1
member.summary: Deletes all the objects from the specified table. WARNING WARNING: Let me repeat. It deletes ALL the objects from the specified table. Do you really want to do that?
member.returns: The number of objects deleted.
member.typeparam: The type of objects to delete.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.DeleteAll(SQLite.TableMapping)
member.summary: Deletes all the objects from the specified table. WARNING WARNING: Let me repeat. It deletes ALL the objects from the specified table. Do you really want to do that?
member.param: The TableMapping used to identify the table.
member.returns: The number of objects deleted.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnection.Backup(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Backup the entire database to the specified path.
member.param: Path to backup file.
The name of the database to backup (usually "main").

member.name: T:SQLite.SQLiteConnectionString
member.summary: Represents a parsed connection string.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnectionString.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructs a new SQLiteConnectionString with all the data needed to open an SQLiteConnection.
member.param: Specifies the path to the database file.

Specifies whether to store DateTime properties as ticks (true) or strings (false). You absolutely do want to store them as Ticks in all new projects. The value of false is only here for backwards compatibility. There is a *significant* speed advantage, with no down sides, when setting storeDateTimeAsTicks = true. If you use DateTimeOffset properties, it will be always stored as ticks regardingless the storeDateTimeAsTicks parameter.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnectionString.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Object,System.Action{SQLite.SQLiteConnection},System.Action{SQLite.SQLiteConnection},System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a new SQLiteConnectionString with all the data needed to open an SQLiteConnection.
member.param: Specifies the path to the database file.

Specifies whether to store DateTime properties as ticks (true) or strings (false). You absolutely do want to store them as Ticks in all new projects. The value of false is only here for backwards compatibility. There is a *significant* speed advantage, with no down sides, when setting storeDateTimeAsTicks = true. If you use DateTimeOffset properties, it will be always stored as ticks regardingless the storeDateTimeAsTicks parameter.
Specifies the encryption key to use on the database. Should be a string or a byte[].
Executes prior to setting key for SQLCipher databases
Executes after setting key for SQLCipher databases
Specifies the Virtual File System to use on the database.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnectionString.#ctor(System.String,SQLite.SQLiteOpenFlags,System.Boolean,System.Object,System.Action{SQLite.SQLiteConnection},System.Action{SQLite.SQLiteConnection},System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructs a new SQLiteConnectionString with all the data needed to open an SQLiteConnection.
member.param: Specifies the path to the database file.
Flags controlling how the connection should be opened.

Specifies whether to store DateTime properties as ticks (true) or strings (false). You absolutely do want to store them as Ticks in all new projects. The value of false is only here for backwards compatibility. There is a *significant* speed advantage, with no down sides, when setting storeDateTimeAsTicks = true. If you use DateTimeOffset properties, it will be always stored as ticks regardingless the storeDateTimeAsTicks parameter.
Specifies the encryption key to use on the database. Should be a string or a byte[].
Executes prior to setting key for SQLCipher databases
Executes after setting key for SQLCipher databases
Specifies the Virtual File System to use on the database.
Specifies the format to use when storing DateTime properties as strings.

Specifies whether to store TimeSpan properties as ticks (true) or strings (false). You absolutely do want to store them as Ticks in all new projects. The value of false is only here for backwards compatibility. There is a *significant* speed advantage, with no down sides, when setting storeTimeSpanAsTicks = true.

member.name: P:SQLite.TableAttribute.WithoutRowId
member.summary:
Flag whether to create the table without rowid (see https://sqlite.org/withoutrowid.html)
The default is false so that sqlite adds an implicit rowid to every table created.

member.name: T:SQLite.CollationAttribute
member.summary: Select the collating sequence to use on a column. "BINARY", "NOCASE", and "RTRIM" are supported. "BINARY" is the default.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteCommand.OnInstanceCreated(System.Object)
member.summary: Invoked every time an instance is loaded from the database.
member.param: The newly created object.
member.remarks: This can be overridden in combination with the method to hook into the life-cycle of objects.

member.name: M:SQLite.FastColumnSetter.GetFastSetter``1(SQLite.SQLiteConnection,SQLite.TableMapping.Column)
member.summary:
Creates a delegate that can be used to quickly set object members from query columns.
Note that this frontloads the slow reflection-based type checking for columns to only happen once at the beginning of a query, and then afterwards each row of the query can invoke the delegate returned by this function to get much better performance (up to 10x speed boost, depending on query size and platform).
member.typeparam: The type of the destination object that the query will read into
member.param: The active connection. Note that this is primarily needed in order to read preferences regarding how certain data types (such as TimeSpan / DateTime) should be encoded in the database.
The table mapping used to map the statement column to a member of the destination object type
member.returns:
A delegate for fast-setting of object members from statement columns.
If no fast setter is available for the requested column (enums in particular cause headache), then this function returns null.

member.name: M:SQLite.FastColumnSetter.CreateNullableTypedSetterDelegate``2(SQLite.TableMapping.Column,System.Func{System.IntPtr,System.Int32,``1})
member.summary:
This creates a strongly typed delegate that will permit fast setting of column values given a Sqlite3Statement and a column index.
Note that this is identical to CreateTypedSetterDelegate(), but has an extra check to see if it should create a nullable version of the delegate.
member.typeparam: The type of the object whose member column is being set
The CLR type of the member in the object which corresponds to the given SQLite columnn
member.param: The column mapping that identifies the target member of the destination object
A lambda that can be used to retrieve the column value at query-time
member.returns: A strongly-typed delegate

member.name: M:SQLite.FastColumnSetter.CreateTypedSetterDelegate``2(SQLite.TableMapping.Column,System.Func{System.IntPtr,System.Int32,``1})
member.summary: This creates a strongly typed delegate that will permit fast setting of column values given a Sqlite3Statement and a column index.
member.typeparam: The type of the object whose member column is being set
The CLR type of the member in the object which corresponds to the given SQLite columnn
member.param: The column mapping that identifies the target member of the destination object
A lambda that can be used to retrieve the column value at query-time
member.returns: A strongly-typed delegate

member.name: T:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection
member.summary: A pooled asynchronous connection to a SQLite database.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructs a new SQLiteAsyncConnection and opens a pooled SQLite database specified by databasePath.
member.param: Specifies the path to the database file.

Specifies whether to store DateTime properties as ticks (true) or strings (false). You absolutely do want to store them as Ticks in all new projects. The value of false is only here for backwards compatibility. There is a *significant* speed advantage, with no down sides, when setting storeDateTimeAsTicks = true. If you use DateTimeOffset properties, it will be always stored as ticks regardingless the storeDateTimeAsTicks parameter.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.#ctor(System.String,SQLite.SQLiteOpenFlags,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructs a new SQLiteAsyncConnection and opens a pooled SQLite database specified by databasePath.
member.param: Specifies the path to the database file.
Flags controlling how the connection should be opened. Async connections should have the FullMutex flag set to provide best performance.

Specifies whether to store DateTime properties as ticks (true) or strings (false). You absolutely do want to store them as Ticks in all new projects. The value of false is only here for backwards compatibility. There is a *significant* speed advantage, with no down sides, when setting storeDateTimeAsTicks = true. If you use DateTimeOffset properties, it will be always stored as ticks regardingless the storeDateTimeAsTicks parameter.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.#ctor(SQLite.SQLiteConnectionString)
member.summary: Constructs a new SQLiteAsyncConnection and opens a pooled SQLite database using the given connection string.
member.param: Details on how to find and open the database.

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.DatabasePath
member.summary: Gets the database path used by this connection.

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.LibVersionNumber
member.summary: Gets the SQLite library version number. 3007014 would be v3.7.14

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.DateTimeStringFormat
member.summary: The format to use when storing DateTime properties as strings. Ignored if StoreDateTimeAsTicks is true.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.GetBusyTimeout
member.summary: The amount of time to wait for a table to become unlocked.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.SetBusyTimeoutAsync(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sets the amount of time to wait for a table to become unlocked.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.EnableWriteAheadLoggingAsync
member.summary: Enables the write ahead logging. WAL is significantly faster in most scenarios by providing better concurrency and better disk IO performance than the normal journal mode. You only need to call this function once in the lifetime of the database.

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.StoreDateTimeAsTicks
member.summary: Whether to store DateTime properties as ticks (true) or strings (false).

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.StoreTimeSpanAsTicks
member.summary: Whether to store TimeSpan properties as ticks (true) or strings (false).

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.Trace
member.summary: Whether to writer queries to during execution.

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.Tracer
member.summary: The delegate responsible for writing trace lines.

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.TimeExecution
member.summary: Whether Trace lines should be written that show the execution time of queries.

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.TableMappings
member.summary: Returns the mappings from types to tables that the connection currently understands.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.ResetPool
member.summary: Closes all connections to all async databases. You should *never* need to do this. This is a blocking operation that will return when all connections have been closed.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.GetConnection
member.summary: Gets the pooled lockable connection used by this async connection. You should never need to use this. This is provided only to add additional functionality to SQLite-net. If you use this connection, you must use the Lock method on it while using it.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.CloseAsync
member.summary: Closes any pooled connections used by the database.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.EnableLoadExtensionAsync(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable or disable extension loading.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.CreateTableAsync``1(SQLite.CreateFlags)
member.summary: Executes a "create table if not exists" on the database. It also creates any specified indexes on the columns of the table. It uses a schema automatically generated from the specified type. You can later access this schema by calling GetMapping.
member.returns: Whether the table was created or migrated.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.CreateTableAsync(System.Type,SQLite.CreateFlags)
member.summary: Executes a "create table if not exists" on the database. It also creates any specified indexes on the columns of the table. It uses a schema automatically generated from the specified type. You can later access this schema by calling GetMapping.
member.param: Type to reflect to a database table.
Optional flags allowing implicit PK and indexes based on naming conventions.
member.returns: Whether the table was created or migrated.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.CreateTablesAsync``2(SQLite.CreateFlags)
member.summary: Executes a "create table if not exists" on the database for each type. It also creates any specified indexes on the columns of the table. It uses a schema automatically generated from the specified type. You can later access this schema by calling GetMapping.
member.returns: Whether the table was created or migrated for each type.

member.returns: Whether the table was created or migrated for each type.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.InsertOrReplaceAsync(System.Object)
member.summary: Inserts the given object (and updates its auto incremented primary key if it has one). The return value is the number of rows added to the table. If a UNIQUE constraint violation occurs with some pre-existing object, this function deletes the old object.

member.returns: The number of rows modified.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.InsertOrReplaceAsync(System.Object,System.Type)
member.summary: Inserts the given object (and updates its auto incremented primary key if it has one). The return value is the number of rows added to the table. If a UNIQUE constraint violation occurs with some pre-existing object, this function deletes the old object.
member.param: The object to insert.
The type of object to insert.
member.returns: The number of rows modified.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.UpdateAsync(System.Object)
member.summary: Updates all of the columns of a table using the specified object except for its primary key. The object is required to have a primary key.
member.param: The object to update. It must have a primary key designated using the PrimaryKeyAttribute.
member.returns: The number of rows updated.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.UpdateAsync(System.Object,System.Type)
member.summary: Updates all of the columns of a table using the specified object except for its primary key. The object is required to have a primary key.

member.returns: The number of rows updated.

A boolean indicating if the inserts should be wrapped in a transaction

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.ExecuteAsync(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a SQLiteCommand given the command text (SQL) with arguments. Place a '?' in the command text for each of the arguments and then executes that command. Use this method instead of Query when you don't expect rows back. Such cases include INSERTs, UPDATEs, and DELETEs. You can set the Trace or TimeExecution properties of the connection to profile execution.
member.param: The fully escaped SQL.
Arguments to substitute for the occurences of '?' in the query.
member.returns: The number of rows modified in the database as a result of this execution.

member.summary: Inserts all specified objects.
member.param:
An of the objects to insert.
A boolean indicating if the inserts should be wrapped in a transaction.
member.returns: The number of rows added to the table.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.InsertAllAsync(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Inserts all specified objects.
member.param: An of the objects to insert.
Literal SQL code that gets placed into the command. INSERT {extra} INTO ...
A boolean indicating if the inserts should be wrapped in a transaction.
member.returns: The number of rows added to the table.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.RunInTransactionAsync(System.Action{SQLite.SQLiteConnection})
member.summary: Executes within a (possibly nested) transaction by wrapping it in a SAVEPOINT. If an exception occurs the whole transaction is rolled back, not just the current savepoint. The exception is rethrown.
member.param: The to perform within a transaction. can contain any number of operations on the connection but should never call or .

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.Table``1
member.summary: Returns a queryable interface to the table represented by the given type.
member.returns: A queryable object that is able to translate Where, OrderBy, and Take queries into native SQL.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.ExecuteScalarAsync``1(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a SQLiteCommand given the command text (SQL) with arguments. Place a '?' in the command text for each of the arguments and then executes that command. Use this method when return primitive values. You can set the Trace or TimeExecution properties of the connection to profile execution.
member.param: The fully escaped SQL.
Arguments to substitute for the occurences of '?' in the query.
member.returns: The number of rows modified in the database as a result of this execution.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.QueryAsync``1(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a SQLiteCommand given the command text (SQL) with arguments. Place a '?' in the command text for each of the arguments and then executes that command. It returns each row of the result using the mapping automatically generated for the given type.
member.param: The fully escaped SQL.
Arguments to substitute for the occurences of '?' in the query.
member.returns: A list with one result for each row returned by the query.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.QueryScalarsAsync``1(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a SQLiteCommand given the command text (SQL) with arguments. Place a '?' in the command text for each of the arguments and then executes that command. It returns the first column of each row of the result.
member.param: The fully escaped SQL.
Arguments to substitute for the occurences of '?' in the query.
member.returns: A list with one result for the first column of each row returned by the query.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.QueryAsync(SQLite.TableMapping,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a SQLiteCommand given the command text (SQL) with arguments. Place a '?' in the command text for each of the arguments and then executes that command. It returns each row of the result using the specified mapping. This function is only used by libraries in order to query the database via introspection. It is normally not used.
member.param: A to use to convert the resulting rows into objects.
The fully escaped SQL.
Arguments to substitute for the occurences of '?' in the query.
member.returns: An enumerable with one result for each row returned by the query.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.DeferredQueryAsync``1(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a SQLiteCommand given the command text (SQL) with arguments. Place a '?' in the command text for each of the arguments and then executes that command. It returns each row of the result using the mapping automatically generated for the given type.
member.param: The fully escaped SQL.
Arguments to substitute for the occurences of '?' in the query.
member.returns: An enumerable with one result for each row returned by the query. The enumerator will call sqlite3_step on each call to MoveNext, so the database connection must remain open for the lifetime of the enumerator.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteAsyncConnection.DeferredQueryAsync(SQLite.TableMapping,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a SQLiteCommand given the command text (SQL) with arguments. Place a '?' in the command text for each of the arguments and then executes that command. It returns each row of the result using the specified mapping. This function is only used by libraries in order to query the database via introspection. It is normally not used.
member.param: A to use to convert the resulting rows into objects.
The fully escaped SQL.
Arguments to substitute for the occurences of '?' in the query.
member.returns: An enumerable with one result for each row returned by the query. The enumerator will call sqlite3_step on each call to MoveNext, so the database connection must remain open for the lifetime of the enumerator.

member.name: T:SQLite.SQLiteConnectionWithLock
member.summary: This is a normal connection except it contains a Lock method that can be used to serialize access to the database in lieu of using the sqlite's FullMutex support.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnectionWithLock.#ctor(SQLite.SQLiteConnectionString)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Connection string containing the DatabasePath.

member.name: P:SQLite.SQLiteConnectionWithLock.SkipLock
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this skip lock.
member.value: true if skip lock; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:SQLite.SQLiteConnectionWithLock.Lock
member.summary: Lock the database to serialize access to it. To unlock it, call Dispose on the returned object.
member.returns: The lock.
